form.IN:
Pri 9. in 10. pomenu je oblika za preteklik in pretekli deležnik
ringed
.

sense.def:
To ring someone
pomeni nekomu telefonirati.

seg.quote: You must ring the hospital at once.

sense.def:
Kadar nekdo
rings a bell
ali kadar zvonec
rings
, se zvonec oglasi s svojim značilnim zvokom.

seg.quote: In the distance a church bell was ringing.
He had to ring the bell several times.
There was a ring at the door.
The barn rang with the cries of geese and turkeys.

sense.def:
Kadar izraz
ring
uporabimo za pridevnikom, povemo, da ima nekaj po našem mnenju določeno lastnost.

seg.quote: The books he mentioned had a familiar ring about them.
The name had an unpleasant ring to it.

sense.def:
A ring
je tudi kovinski obroček, ki ga nosimo na prstu kot okras ali znamenje, da smo poročeni.

A ring
je predmet ali skupina stvari, ki ima obliko kroga.

seg.quote: They formed a ring round him.

sense.def:
The ring
je ograjen prostor, okoli katerega so razporejeni sedeži in na katerem potekajo tekmovanja v boksu ali cirkuške predstave.

To ring something
pomeni narisati krog okoli nečesa.

seg.quote: I got a map and ringed all the likely villages.

sense.def:
Kraj ali prostor
is ringed with something
, kadar ga nekaj obdaja.

A ring
je tudi skupina ljudi, ki se skupaj ukvarjajo z nezakonitimi posli, na primer prodajo mamil ali nadzorom nad prodajo umetnin ali starin.

seg.quote: ...a large drug ring operating in the area.

sense.def:
To give someone a ring
pomeni poklicati nekoga po telefonu;

seg.quote: Give me a ring if you need me.

sense.def:
Kadar trditev
rings true
, se nam zdi, da je resnična.

seg.quote: The bishop's answers so often ring true.

sense.def:
To ring someone back
pomeni poklicati po telefonu nekoga, ki je prej telefoniral nam.

seg.quote: He asked if you'd ring him back when you got in.

sense.def:
To ring off
pomeni odložiti slušalko na koncu telefonskega pogovora.

To ring someone up
pomeni telefonirati nekomu.
